thread.title: Large sinkhole in San Francisco Bay Area city closes road
thread.title_full: Large sinkhole in San Francisco Bay Area city closes road

author: The Associated Press
title: Large sinkhole in San Francisco Bay Area city closes road
text:
Large sinkhole in San Francisco Bay Area city closes road The Associated Press UNION CITY, Calif. 
Crews are working to repair a sinkhole that opened up on a Union City street and soon after filled with water. 
KTVU-TV reports ( http://bit.ly/1X5pKHY ) the roughly 12- by 10-foot sinkhole at the intersection of Alvarado Boulevard and New Haven Street was first reported Wednesday afternoon. 
It was at around 7:30 p.m. when noticed water was starting to bubble up from underneath the sinkhole. Soon afterwards, the hole was completely filled. 
Alameda County fire spokeswoman Aisha Knowles says the hole was first reported by a passerby, who knocked on the firehouse door and alerted the firefighters to the sagging roadway. 
It is unclear what caused the sinkhole and Alvarado Boulevard remains closed. Related content
